title: UNDO YOUR LAST HOTFIX
body: I cannot even load the game. "Client not responding" as soon as champ select is over. I have lost 4 games because I never connected. Lost promos, now I am in low priority queue ... Guess its off to Fortnite or Paragon

replies.body: The hotfix just killed my FPS. They were finally good again after months but the moment the hotfix hit live they went downhill once again. :/

I am having this exact issue. I have tried reinstalling the client, no result. I have tried running the Hextech Repair Tool, no result either. I combed my log files, but cannot understand anything in them that seems to  be causing the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Motoriffic,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8nQdttQd,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-06-15T23:30:14.325+0000)
>
> I cannot even load the game. &quot;Client not responding&quot; as soon as champ select is over. I have lost 4 games because I never connected. Lost promos, now I am in low priority queue ... Guess its off to Fortnite or Paragon

Depends on your system specs and what you have open. 
Could be you do not have enough RAM or background apps are taking up your system resources.
Maybe you are downloading somethings to your main drive and the drive is overloaded.
Could be your firewall blocked you from connecting to the game.
Have you tried a repair option on the client?
Def not a Ram or system issue. Its my baby and its a beefy smooth running baby

You dont know that - hardware has nothing to do with software stability. Especially if you left windows update on, all sorts of stuff gets fucked up by it.

Not to mention 'a few thousand dollars of hardware' sounds like a pretty badly planned system and could well have some instabilities going on, unless it is primarily a rendering workstation or such.

Plus you have no control over your WAN connection. Have you checked the game and router logs (if you dont have router logs, run firmware that is not shit)?

I run Google Wifi with Mesh routing. Firmware is up-to-date. I have zero problems with anything else and had zero problems until the second it patched the hot fix.  Many people are having this issue. It's not just me guy. And no its not a badly planned system.  I buy nice things that are known to work well and last a long time and as such they can cost more. I don't just go buy shit and throw it in a case and pray to god it all works. I've been building PC's for a decade. All my software is updated as well as the firmware.

> All my software is updated as well as the firmware.

That is usually not a good thing. But if others are reporting the issue, either compare hardware/software and see if the is a correlation, or just wait for a fix.

Also what the shit is "google wifi" meant to be. Did you mean google fiber?
Have you tried anything at all before assuming it was the client patch and not your system, network, or the server?

I have not changed a thing. I pretty much only play League of legends. I don't play until all my updates are done and I am very meticulous with my system. I built my PC from scratch and its got a few thousand dollars worth of hardware. And as far as network Its lightning fast and completely operational. That is most definitely not the problem. I would not be as furious with the game as I am had I not checked a few things first.
Paragon was stopped awhile ago but nice meme xD
Oh then It'll feel just about the same
